definitions.definition: The Christian religious tradition based upon the doctrines and forms of Christian practice of several Protestant reformers , especially John Calvin , in contrast to Catholicism , Lutheranism , Anabaptism , and Arminianism . One distinctive trait of the system is its Augustinian doctrine of predestination , which teaches that God has elected some for salvation , apart from anything they do or believe.

main_definition: The Christian religious tradition based upon the doctrines and forms of Christian practice of several Protestant reformers , especially John Calvin , in contrast to Catholicism , Lutheranism , Anabaptism , and Arminianism . One distinctive trait of the system is its Augustinian doctrine of predestination , which teaches that God has elected some for salvation , apart from anything they do or believe.
